position.marginalia_text: De fa[e]ce non haurit Musa Attica: nec Aquila capit Muscas.

marginalia.translation: The Greek Muse does not drink the dregs, nor does the Eagle capture Flies.
The lawyer cares not for minutiae.

position.marginalia_text: Ingenij, et Virtutis panis quotidianus, Temperantia.

marginalia.translation: Temperance is the daily bread of genius and virtue.
The food of conemplation and action.

position.marginalia_text: A mans tounge, is his honour, or shame. Salomo.

marginalia.translation: Language is the best aspect of good men and the worst aspect of evil men.

position.marginalia_text: I looue Epitomes: but not Deminutiues.
( Satis: si satis promptè, et absolute. )

marginalia.translation: It is enough, if done promptly and completely enough.

position.marginalia_text: Magneticus, et marmoreus valor: maximus mundi attractivus.

marginalia.translation: A magnetic and marble valor is the greatest attractive valor in the world.

position.marginalia_text: Elegans eloquendi facilitas; et ciuilis conversandi gratia; vtraq[ue] apta, et decora; duo cuiusq[ue] pra[e]clari hominis complementa.

marginalia.translation: An elegant facility in speaking and a civil gracefulness in conversing; both appropriate and decorous, both complementary aspects of any illustrious man.

position.marginalia_text: Fortis animus; et astutum ingenium; duo pragmatici arcana, semper securi.

marginalia.translation: A strong mind and an astute natural character, two concealed aspects of a pragmatic man who is always untroubled.
